# Draft:Sam Ward (entrepreneur)

Sam Ward (born 1992) is a British legal entrepreneur and the director of Sentinel Legal Limited, a consumer litigation firm based in Cheltenham with offices in Manchester. He is known for his role in exposing the United Kingdom's motor finance mis-selling scandal and for leading litigation against major lenders over undisclosed commissions in car finance agreements.
Early life and education
Ward was born in Manchester, England, in 1992. He studied law and began his career in the consumer legal services sector during the 2010s, developing a focus on financial-services disputes and unfair-relationship claims.
Career
Ward founded Sentinel Legal Limited in 2022, establishing the firm as one of the first in the UK to litigate large-scale car-finance commission claims.  The firm is headquartered in Cheltenham with an additional office in Manchester.
Under Ward’s direction, Sentinel Legal became one of the largest litigators of motor-finance mis-selling claims in the United Kingdom, having issued hundreds of court cases against leading lenders and obtained £8 million in litigation funding to support consumers.  Ward and his firm are widely regarded as having brought the car-finance mis-selling issue to public attention and were among the first to provide data and consumer evidence to the Financial Conduct Authority’s investigation into historic motor-finance commission arrangements.
Legal work
While Sentinel Legal was not formally named as a solicitor on record in the test case of Johnson v FirstRand Bank Ltd, it supported HD Law, the firm representing the claimant, by developing early case evidence and public awareness around the litigation.  Ward’s contributions to this area of law have been credited with helping to establish the framework for consumer redress in the UK motor-finance market.
Media and public commentary
Ward has appeared in national broadcast and print media to discuss consumer litigation and the car-finance mis-selling scandal.  He is also the host of the Sentinel Legal Podcast, available on Spotify and Apple Podcasts, where he interviews legal experts and industry figures about developments in consumer law.
Recognition
Ward and Sentinel Legal have been cited by UK and international media as leading figures in the motor-finance redress movement, with commentators crediting the firm’s litigation for prompting regulatory action and public awareness.
